aws::graph::propositions: # Pilot and Aircraft Component Information
The pilot held an airline transport certificate.
The pilot held a commercial certificate.
The pilot was a flight instructor.
The pilot was 47 years old.
The pilot had airplane ratings for single-engine land.
The pilot had airplane ratings for single-engine sea.
The pilot had airplane ratings for multi-engine land.
The pilot occupied the left seat.
The pilot had helicopter rating.
The pilot used a 3-point restraint.
The pilot had instrument rating for airplane.
No second pilot was present.
The pilot had instructor ratings for airplane multi-engine.
The pilot had instructor ratings for airplane single-engine.
The pilot had instructor ratings for instrument airplane.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.
The pilot held a Class 1 medical certification with waivers/limitations.
The pilot's last Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) medical exam was on April 26, 2014.
The pilot was an occupational pilot.
The pilot's last flight review or equivalent was on April 30, 2014.
The pilot had 8540 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The pilot had 24 total flight hours in this make and model of aircraft.
The pilot had 8281 hours as Pilot In Command in all aircraft.
The pilot had 171 flight hours in the last 90 days in all aircraft.
The pilot had 32 flight hours in the last 30 days in all aircraft.
The fuel pump was part number 638154-1.
The fuel pump had serial number 1752.
The fuel pump did not exhibit external damage.
The spline on the fuel pump was intact.
The fuel pump rotated when actuated by hand.
The fuel pump was installed on a test stand.
The fuel pump ran at rpms between 700 and 3,200 for several minutes.
The fuel pump functioned as designed.
The fuel pump recorded high pressure.
The left magneto was Slick model number 6210.
The left magneto had serial number 90080047.
The left magneto did not exhibit external damage.
The left magneto was installed on a test bench.
The left magneto ran at different rpms for several minutes.
A blue spark was observed on each lead of the left magneto at varying rpms.
The right magneto was Slick model number 6210.
The right magneto had serial number 91040206.
The right magneto did not exhibit external damage.
The right magneto was installed on a test bench.
The right magneto ran at different rpms for several minutes.
A blue spark was observed on each lead of the right magneto at varying rpms.
Two passengers reported to a Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) inspector that the airplane was "chartered" by a third passenger.
The charter was for a round trip flight to EYW.
A credit card receipt for $1,180.80 was provided to investigators.
The credit card receipt was charged on the third passenger's credit card.
The credit card receipt was charged by the operator, Exec Air.

text:
# Pilot Information

## Certificate:
Airline transport; Commercial; Flight instructor

## Age:
47

## Airplane Rating(s):
Single-engine land; Single-engine sea; Multi-engine land

## Seat Occupied:
Left

## Other Aircraft Rating(s):
Helicopter

## Restraint Used:
3-point

## Instrument Rating(s):
Airplane

## Second Pilot Present:
No

## Instructor Rating(s):
Airplane multi-engine; Airplane single-engine; Instrument airplane

## Toxicology Performed:
No

## Medical Certification:
Class 1 With waivers/limitations

## Last FAA Medical Exam:
April 26, 2014

## Occupational Pilot:
Yes

## Last Flight Review or Equivalent:
April 30, 2014

## Flight Time:
8540 hours (Total, all aircraft), 24 hours (Total, this make and model), 8281 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 171 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 32 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft)

The fuel pump (part # 638154-1; serial # 1752) did not exhibit external damage. The spline on the fuel pump was intact and the unit rotated when actuated by hand. The fuel pump was installed on a test stand and ran at rpms between 700 and 3,200 for several minutes. The unit functioned as designed and the recorded pressure was high.

The left magneto (Slick model # 6210; serial # 90080047) did not exhibit external damage. The left magneto was installed on a test bench and ran at different rpms for several minutes. A blue spark was observed on each lead at varying rpms. The right magneto (Slick model # 6210; serial #91040206) did not exhibit external damage. The right magneto was installed on a test bench and ran at different rpms for several minutes. A blue spark was observed on each lead at varying rpms.

Two passengers reported to an FAA inspector that the airplane was "chartered" by a third passenger for the round trip flight to EYW. A credit card receipt for $1,180.80 was provided to investigators, on the third passenger's credit card and charged by the operator, Exec Air.
